events.title: February Revolution begins in Russia
events.description: Protests and strikes in Petrograd escalate into the February Revolution, leading to the abdication of Tsar Nicholas II and the end of the Romanov dynasty.
events.significance: Led to the establishment of a provisional government and set the stage for the Russian Civil War and eventual rise of the Soviet Union.

events.title: International Women's Day proclaimed
events.description: The International Socialist Women's Conference designated March 8 as International Women's Day to honor women's rights and promote gender equality.
events.significance: Became a global day recognizing women's achievements and campaigning for women's rights and equality.

events.title: Spanish Civil War ends
events.description: Madrid falls to Francisco Franco's forces, marking the end of the Spanish Civil War and the start of Franco's dictatorship.
events.significance: Led to nearly four decades of fascist rule in Spain and shaped political dynamics in Europe pre-World War II.

events.title: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 disappears
events.description: Flight MH370 vanished en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing, sparking one of the largest aviation search efforts in history.
events.significance: The disappearance remains one of the greatest aviation mysteries, leading to changes in aircraft tracking and international aviation protocols.
